100_to_150_words: A marriage ceremony is the formal recognition of a union between two people in the presence of witnesses. It is a traditional and important celebration of their commitment to each other and is a public declaration of their love and devotion. The ceremony usually includes an exchange of vows, a formal exchange of rings, and a pronouncement of marriage by a presiding official. The couple will typically make a vow to remain faithful to each other and exchange rings to symbolize their commitment. They may also make promises to each other, sign a marriage license, and exchange a kiss to seal the ceremony. Marriage ceremonies can vary greatly depending on the couple's cultural and religious beliefs. The ceremony is a significant event in the lives of the bride and groom, and it marks the start of a lifelong commitment to each other.
